qas.question: When did the Chinese government ban the purchase of Windows 8 products?
Why did the Chinese government ban Windows 8 based products?

answers.text: in protest of Microsoft's support lifecycle policy and the end of support for Windows XP

plausible_answers.text: in protest of Microsoft's support lifecycle policy and the end of support for Windows XP

qas.question: Why did the Chinese government ban Windows 9 based products?
What market share did Windows PX have in China?
Who claimed that the Windows 9 would allow the US Government to spy on its users?

context: In <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>May 2014<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, the Government of China banned the internal purchase of Windows 8-based products under government contracts requiring "energy-efficient" devices. The Xinhua News Agency claimed that Windows 8 was being banned <a1_0><b6_0>in protest of Microsoft's support lifecycle policy and the end of support for Windows XP<b6_0/><a1_0/> (which, as of January 2014, had a market share of <a2_0><b7_0>49%<b7_0/><a2_0/> in China), as the government "obviously cannot ignore the risks of running OS [sic] without guaranteed technical support." However, <a3_0><b8_0>Ni Guangnan<b8_0/><a3_0/> of the Chinese Academy of Sciences had also previously warned that Windows 8 could allegedly expose users to surveillance by the United States government due to its heavy use of internet-based services.
